args.natural_language_statement:
Every finite simple group is isomorphic to one of the following groups: (1) A cyclic group of prime order. (2) An alternating group of degree at least 5. (3) A simple group of Lie type, including both (4) the classical Lie groups, namely the simple groups related to the projective special linear, unitary, symplectic, or orthogonal transformations over a finite field; (5) the exceptional and twisted groups of Lie type (including the Tits group). (6) One of the 26 sporadic simple groups.

Translate into Lean4 theorem statement (no proof). Use Mathlib. End the theorem with := by sorry

args.content:
import Mathlib

/-- Uninterpreted predicates to identify families of known finite simple groups.
    We introduce these as constants so the classification statement can refer to them
    even though Mathlib may not contain concrete definitions for all families.
-/
constant IsAlternatingGroup : ∀ (H : Type _) (_inst : Group H) (n : ℕ), Prop
constant IsLieType : ∀ (H : Type _) (_inst : Group H), Prop
constant IsSporadicGroup : ∀ (H : Type _) (_inst : Group H) (i : Fin 26), Prop

/-- Classification of finite simple groups (statement only, no proof).
    Every finite simple group is isomorphic to one of the following:
    * a cyclic group of prime order;
    * an alternating group of degree at least 5;
    * a simple group of Lie type (classical or exceptional/twisted, including the Tits group);
    * one of the 26 sporadic simple groups.
-/
theorem classification_of_finite_simple_groups :
  ∀ (G : Type _) [Group G] [Fintype G], IsSimpleGroup G →
    (∃ (p : ℕ) (hp : Nat.Prime p), MulEquiv G (Multiplicative (ZMod p))) ∨
    (∃ (n : ℕ) (hn : 5 ≤ n) (H : Type _) (instH : Group H) (fH : Fintype H),
        IsAlternatingGroup H instH n ∧ (MulEquiv G H)) ∨
    (∃ (H : Type _) (instH : Group H) (fH : Fintype H),
        IsLieType H instH ∧ (MulEquiv G H)) ∨
    (∃ (i : Fin 26) (H : Type _) (instH : Group H) (fH : Fintype H),
        IsSporadicGroup H instH i ∧ (MulEquiv G H)) := by sorry

import Mathlib

/-- Predicates naming the families occurring in the classification.  These are
    uninterpreted constants: we only state the classification, not provide
    constructions for these families in Mathlib.
-/
constant IsAlternatingGroup : Type _ → Prop
constant IsLieType : Type _ → Prop
constant IsSporadicGroup : Type _ → Prop

/-- Classification of finite simple groups (statement only, no proof).
    Every finite simple group is isomorphic to one of the following:
    (1) a cyclic group of prime order;
    (2) an alternating group of degree at least 5;
    (3) a simple group of Lie type (classical or exceptional/twisted);
    (4) one of the 26 sporadic simple groups.
-/
theorem classification_of_finite_simple_groups :
  ∀ (G : Type _) [Group G] [Fintype G], IsSimpleGroup G →
    (∃ (p : ℕ), Nat.Prime p ∧ Nonempty (G ≃* Multiplicative (ZMod p))) ∨
    (∃ (n : ℕ) (hn : 5 ≤ n) (H : Type _) (instH : Group H) (fH : Fintype H),
        IsAlternatingGroup H ∧ Nonempty (G ≃* H)) ∨
    (∃ (H : Type _) (instH : Group H) (fH : Fintype H),
        IsLieType H ∧ Nonempty (G ≃* H)) ∨
    (∃ (i : Fin 26) (H : Type _) (instH : Group H) (fH : Fintype H),
        IsSporadicGroup H ∧ Nonempty (G ≃* H)) := by sorry

import Mathlib

universe u

/-- Predicates naming the families occurring in the classification. These are
    uninterpreted constants: we only state the classification, not provide
    constructions for these families in Mathlib. -/
constant IsAlternatingGroup : Type u → Prop
constant IsLieType : Type u → Prop
constant IsSporadicGroup : Type u → Prop

/-- Classification of finite simple groups (statement only, no proof).
    Every finite simple group is isomorphic to one of the following:
    (1) a cyclic group of prime order;
    (2) an alternating group of degree at least 5;
    (3) a simple group of Lie type (classical or exceptional/twisted);
    (4) one of the 26 sporadic simple groups.
-/
theorem classification_of_finite_simple_groups :
  ∀ (G : Type u) [Group G] [Fintype G], IsSimpleGroup G →
    (∃ (p : ℕ), Nat.Prime p ∧ Nonempty (G ≃* Multiplicative (ZMod p))) ∨
    (∃ (n : ℕ) (hn : 5 ≤ n) (H : Type u) (instH : Group H) (fH : Fintype H),
        IsAlternatingGroup H ∧ Nonempty (G ≃* H)) ∨
    (∃ (H : Type u) (instH : Group H) (fH : Fintype H),
        IsLieType H ∧ Nonempty (G ≃* H)) ∨
    (∃ (i : Fin 26) (H : Type u) (instH : Group H) (fH : Fintype H),
        IsSporadicGroup H ∧ Nonempty (G ≃* H)) := by sorry

import Mathlib

universe u

/-- Predicates naming the families occurring in the classification.  These are
    uninterpreted constants: we only state the classification, not provide
    constructions for these families in Mathlib. -/
constant IsAlternatingGroup : Type u → ℕ → Prop
constant IsLieType : Type u → Prop
constant IsSporadicGroup : Type u → Fin 26 → Prop

/-- Classification of finite simple groups (statement only, no proof).
    Every finite simple group is isomorphic to one of the following:
    (1) a cyclic group of prime order;
    (2) an alternating group of degree at least 5;
    (3) a simple group of Lie type (classical or exceptional/twisted);
    (4) one of the 26 sporadic simple groups.
-/
theorem classification_of_finite_simple_groups :
  ∀ (G : Type u) [Group G] [Fintype G], IsSimpleGroup G →
    (∃ (p : ℕ), Nat.Prime p ∧ Nonempty (G ≃* Multiplicative (ZMod p))) ∨
    (∃ (n : ℕ) (hn : 5 ≤ n) (H : Type u), IsAlternatingGroup H n ∧ Nonempty (G ≃* H)) ∨
    (∃ (H : Type u), IsLieType H ∧ Nonempty (G ≃* H)) ∨
    (∃ (i : Fin 26) (H : Type u), IsSporadicGroup H i ∧ Nonempty (G ≃* H)) := by sorry

import Mathlib

universe u

/-- Predicates naming the families occurring in the classification. These are
    uninterpreted constants: we only state the classification, not provide
    constructions for these families in Mathlib. -/
constant IsAlternatingGroup : ∀ (H : Type u) [_ : Group H], ℕ → Prop
constant IsLieType : ∀ (H : Type u) [_ : Group H], Prop
constant IsSporadicGroup : ∀ (H : Type u) [_ : Group H], Fin 26 → Prop

/-- Classification of finite simple groups (statement only, no proof).
    Every finite simple group is isomorphic to one of the following:
    (1) a cyclic group of prime order;
    (2) an alternating group of degree at least 5;
    (3) a simple group of Lie type (classical or exceptional/twisted);
    (4) one of the 26 sporadic simple groups.
-/
theorem classification_of_finite_simple_groups :
  ∀ (G : Type u) [Group G] [Fintype G], IsSimpleGroup G →
    (∃ (p : ℕ), Nat.Prime p ∧ Nonempty (G ≃* Multiplicative (ZMod p))) ∨
    (∃ (n : ℕ) (hn : 5 ≤ n) (H : Type u) (instH : Group H) (fH : Fintype H),
        IsAlternatingGroup H instH n ∧ Nonempty (G ≃* H)) ∨
    (∃ (H : Type u) (instH : Group H) (fH : Fintype H),
        IsLieType H instH ∧ Nonempty (G ≃* H)) ∨
    (∃ (i : Fin 26) (H : Type u) (instH : Group H) (fH : Fintype H),
        IsSporadicGroup H instH i ∧ Nonempty (G ≃* H)) := by sorry

import Mathlib

universe u

constant IsAlternatingGroup : Type u → ℕ → Prop
constant IsLieType : Type u → Prop

    (2) an alternating group of degree at least 5;
    (3) a simple group of Lie type (classical or exceptional/twisted);
    (4) one of the 26 sporadic simple groups.

  ∀ (G : Type u) [Group G] [Fintype G], IsSimpleGroup G →
    (∃ (p : ℕ), Nat.Prime p ∧ Nonempty (G ≃* Multiplicative (ZMod p))) ∨
    (∃ (n : ℕ) (hn : 5 ≤ n) (H : Type u) (instH : Group H) (fH : Fintype H),

import Mathlib

universe u

/-- Predicates naming the families occurring in the classification. These are
    uninterpreted constants: we only state the classification, not provide
    constructions for these families in Mathlib. -/
constant IsAlternatingGroup : ∀ {H : Type u} [Group H], ℕ → Prop
constant IsLieType : ∀ {H : Type u} [Group H], Prop
constant IsSporadicGroup : ∀ {H : Type u} [Group H], Fin 26 → Prop

/-- Classification of finite simple groups (statement only, no proof).
    Every finite simple group is isomorphic to one of the following:
    (1) a cyclic group of prime order;
    (2) an alternating group of degree at least 5;
    (3) a simple group of Lie type (classical or exceptional/twisted);
    (4) one of the 26 sporadic simple groups.
-/
theorem classification_of_finite_simple_groups :
  ∀ (G : Type u) [Group G] [Fintype G], IsSimpleGroup G →
    (∃ (p : ℕ), Nat.Prime p ∧ Nonempty (G ≃* Multiplicative (ZMod p))) ∨
    (∃ (n : ℕ) (hn : 5 ≤ n) (H : Type u) [instH : Group H] [fH : Fintype H],
        IsAlternatingGroup n ∧ Nonempty (G ≃* H)) ∨
    (∃ (H : Type u) [instH : Group H] [fH : Fintype H],
        IsLieType ∧ Nonempty (G ≃* H)) ∨
    (∃ (i : Fin 26) (H : Type u) [instH : Group H] [fH : Fintype H],
        IsSporadicGroup i ∧ Nonempty (G ≃* H)) := by sorry
